perturbation.original_text: 4.3 Party B shall first pay a deposit of RMB100,000 to Party A within 5 working days after the signing of this Agreement. For list more products, Party B shall apply to Party A 3 working days in advance and after obtaining the consent of Party A, pay the deposit in full within 5 working days from the date of receipt of the deposit notice from Party A.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.3 Party B shall first pay a deposit of RMB100,000 to Party A within 1 working day after the signing of this Agreement. For list more products, Party B shall apply to Party A 1 working day in advance and after obtaining the consent of Party A, pay the deposit in full within 1 working day from the date of receipt of the deposit notice from Party A.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the payment period for the deposit to 1 working day after signing the agreement puts undue pressure on Party B and may violate fair business practice regulations, especially if such a short timeframe is not standard in similar agreements in China. It creates an unreasonably short deadline.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates Article 4 of the Contract Law of the People's Republic of China, regarding fairness and good faith in contractual relationships and potentially violates the law of protecting small and medium sized enterprises.

perturbation.original_text: 3.2.4 Party B shall be obliged to verify the actual use of the leased vehicles, assist and ensure that the Driver User purchases corresponding insurance according to the actual use of the leased vehicles; if the leased vehicle is used for online Ride- hailing operation, in case that the provisions of the local Laws on online Ride-hailing insurance are changed within the term of cooperation or the provisions of the local Laws on online Ride-hailing are officially implemented within the term of cooperation, Party B shall inform the Driver User within 3 working days after the change of local Laws and regulations on Ride-hailing or the effective implementation thereof, assist the Driver User and ensure that the insurance of the leased vehicle shall be changed in accordance with the provisions of local Laws on ride-hailing to make the insurance of the leased vehicle comply with the provisions of relevant Laws and regulations on Ride-hailing at that time.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.2.4 Party B shall be obliged to verify the actual use of the leased vehicles, assist and ensure that the Driver User purchases corresponding insurance according to the actual use of the leased vehicles; if the leased vehicle is used for online Ride- hailing operation, in case that the provisions of the local Laws on online Ride-hailing insurance are changed within the term of cooperation or the provisions of the local Laws on online Ride-hailing are officially implemented within the term of cooperation, Party B shall inform the Driver User within 7 working days after the change of local Laws and regulations on Ride-hailing or the effective implementation thereof, assist the Driver User and ensure that the insurance of the leased vehicle shall be changed in accordance with the provisions of local Laws on ride-hailing to make the insurance of the leased vehicle comply with the provisions of relevant Laws and regulations on Ride-hailing at that time.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the notification timeframe from 3 to 7 working days, when laws and regulations change, may not provide sufficient time for driver users to adjust their insurance coverage and could create legal liability issues in case of accidents with insufficient insurance, violating local Ride-hailing laws. Therefore, changing 3 to 7 days affects the safety of the driver.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates local regulations related to ride-hailing insurance requirements and driver/passenger safety. Specific regulations vary by location but this impacts compliance with those rules.

perturbation.original_text: 9.1.3 Unless otherwise agreed, the other party is in violation of any provision of this Agreement and fails to remedy such violation within 30 days from the receipt of notice of such violation from such party (if capable of remedy);
perturbation.changed_text: 9.1.3 Unless otherwise agreed, the other party is in violation of any provision of this Agreement and fails to remedy such violation within 10 days from the receipt of notice of such violation from such party (if capable of remedy);
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the time to remedy a violation from 30 days to 10 days may be considered unreasonable in certain situations, especially for complex breaches that require more time to rectify. This could conflict with principles of fairness and reasonableness under Chinese Contract Law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates Article 5 of the Contract Law of the People's Republic of China, which emphasizes fairness in determining each party's rights and obligations.
